name: Moby
tagline: The Moby rigid body dynamics simulator
body:
![Moby](http://http://positronicslab.github.io/Moby/images/moby.png)

### What makes **Moby** special?
Most multi-rigid body simulations present the user with numerous parameters to tune, and poor tuning can result in clear physical artifacts or simulation instability. **Moby** aims for minimal parameter tuning through _true rigidity_: interpenetration is eliminated, bodies do not detach at joints, and joints do not move beyond their range of motion.   

### Features (current and slated)
| Feature  | Availability |
|---|---|
| Independent coordinate representation  | _current_  |
| Jacobian computations  | _current_  |
| Implicit joint constraints (for bodies with kinematic loops)  | Fall 2015  |
| Projected constraint stabilization  | Fall 2015  |
| [SDF](http://sdformat.org) support  | _current_  |
| Variable step integration  | Fall 2015  |
| Saving/restoring simulations  | _current_  |
| Energy dissipation for stable simulations | Fall 2015 |
| Gears | Fall 2015 |
| Revolute joints | _current_ |
| Prismatic joints | _current_ |
| Spherical joints | _current_ |
| Universal joints | _current_ |
| Fixed joints | _current_ |
| Joint limits | _current_ |
| Full unit tests  | Fall 2015  |

### Collision primitives supported
|   | Sphere | Box | Cylinder | Plane | Cone | Convex polyhedron | Heightmap |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| **Sphere** | ◉ | ◉ | Summer 2016 | ◉| Summer 2016 | Fall 2015 | ◉  |
| **Box** | ◉ | Fall 2015 | Summer 2016 | ◉ | Summer 2016 | Fall 2015 | Fall 2015  |
| **Cylinder** | Summer 2016 | Summer 2016 | Summer 2016 | ◒ | Summer 2016 | Summer 2016 | Summer 2016 |
| **Plane** | ◉ | ◒ | ◉ | N/A | ◉ | ◉ | N/A  |
| **Cone** | Summer 2016 | Summer 2016 | Summer 2016 | ◒ | Summer 2016 | Summer 2016 | Summer 2016 |
| **Convex polyhedron** | Fall 2015 | Fall 2015 | Summer 2016 | ◉ | ◉ | Fall 2015 | Fall 2015  |
| **Heightmap** | ◉ | Fall 2015 | Summer 2016 | Summer 2016 | N/A | Summer 2016 | Fall 2015 | N/A  |
* ◉ indicates full support
* ◒ indicates support through a discretization of a primitive (small interpenetration may result)
